alert.note: Alert for Columbia (Arkansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 22 at 1:13PM CST until further notice by NWS Shreveport
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Shreveport LA has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Arkansas...Louisiana... Bayou Dorcheat Near Springhill affecting Columbia and Webster Parishes. .An active storm track will lead to several rounds of heavy rainfall through Wednesday night. Rainfall totals around 5 to 7 inches will be possible with locally higher amounts possible. For the Bayou Dorcheat...including Springhill, Dixie Inn, Lake Bistineau...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM LATE TUESDAY NIGHT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Bayou Dorcheat near Springhill. * WHEN...From late Tuesday night until further notice. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 12:00 PM CST Monday the stage was 7.2 feet. - Bankfull stage is 11.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage early Wednesday morning and continue rising to a crest of 15.0 feet Friday morning. - Flood stage is 11.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 15.2 feet on 04/14/2017. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Do not drive cars through flooded areas. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. For more hydrologic information, copy and paste the following website address into your favorite web browser URL bar: water.weather.gov/ahps2/index.php?wfo=shv The next statement will be issued Tuesday afternoon at 115 PM CST.
